meanings.sent1: Ageing can bring wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent2: The ageing of a tree can be seen in its rings.
meanings.sent3: They joked about the ageing of their favorite actor.
meanings.sent4: The ageing of a building can add character and charm.
meanings.sent5: The ageing of a fine wine enhances its flavor and complexity.

meanings.sent1: The ageing dog moved slowly and carefully.
meanings.sent2: Her ageing parents needed extra care and attention.
meanings.sent3: The ageing car sputtered and coughed on the road.
meanings.sent4: The ageing book had yellowed pages and a musty smell.
meanings.sent5: His ageing face had deep wrinkles and silver hair.

meanings.definition: To make or become old or older
meanings.sent1: Leaving the painting in the sun can quickly age it.
meanings.sent2: She used a special technique to age the paper for her project.
meanings.sent3: He tried to age himself with makeup for the play.
meanings.sent4: The antique shop owner knew how to age furniture beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The weathering process can age rocks over time.
